Dont agree Rich, If a novice (or indeed anyone else)  submits something the=
y have no clue about I think it would be useful at least to be told what th=
e tsuba/ sword etc was trying to be. using a catch-all Bungo-Takada, echize=
n seki, or shiomi attribution does little to advance their knowledge. At le=
ast if they were told what it was copying they could look at originals and =
see the differences.
  Also I am not sure (though I have never had to do it=
) why saying "Kyo-kinko in the style of" need necessarily take much more ti=
me. I would assume the panel would know what the artist was trying to emula=
te to be able to dismiss it as a copy. 
  Sorry if this is too simplistic, =
Im the same with software, I always think problems are easy to solve but th=
en I dont have to do it!!
